required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity Study of Traveler's Diarrhea Vaccine Patch
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Gender-Stratified, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of a Two Vaccination Regimen With the Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System in Healthy Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate and compare the safety and immune responses following a two vaccination regimen by transcutaneous immunization with heat-labile enterotoxin of E. coli (LT) patches or Placebo, with or without alcohol swabbing

primary_outcome.measure: Characterization and Comparison of the Safety of the TD Vaccine System: (1) Solicited and Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) (2) Clinical Laboratory Safety (3) Serious AEs
primary_outcome.description: Erythema, rash, pain, pruritus, hyperpigmentation, hypopigmentation and edema were solicited local AEs for the duration of the study. Fever, malaise, headache, and diarrhea were solicited systemic AEs for the first seven days following each vaccination; events reported outside this time frame were considered non-solicited.

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterization and Comparison of Group LT-specific Immune Responses to the TD Vaccine System: Geometric Mean Titers
secondary_outcome.description: LT immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin A (IgA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterization and Comparison of Group LT-specific Immune Responses to the TD Vaccine System: Geometric Mean Fold Ratios
secondary_outcome.description: LT immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin A (IgA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterization and Comparison of Group LT-specific Immune Responses to the TD Vaccine System: Seroconversion Rates
secondary_outcome.description: LT immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin A (IgA)

arm_group.description: Two vaccination regimen with an LT patch (no swabbing)
Two vaccination regimen with an LT patch (with swabbing)
Two vaccination regimen with a placebo patch (no swabbing)
Two vaccination regimen with a placebo patch (with swabbing)

group.title: Group 1: 37.5μg LT, No Swab
group.description: Two vaccination regimen with an LT patch (no swabbing) Heat-Labile Enterotoxin of E. coli (LT): Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

group.title: Group 2: 37.5μg LT, Swab
group.description: Two vaccination regimen with an LT patch (with swabbing) Heat-Labile Enterotoxin of E. coli (LT): Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

group.title: Group 3: 0μg LT, No Swab
group.description: Two vaccination regimen with a placebo patch (no swabbing) Placebo: Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

group.title: Group 4: 0μg LT, Swab
group.description: Two vaccination regimen with a placebo patch (with swabbing) Placebo: Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

participants_list.participants: all subjects followed till Day180;if ongoing local AE, FU every 6 mths till AE resolved (max.Day720)
all subjects followed till Day180;if ongoing local AE, FU every 6 mths till AE resolved (max.Day720)

baseline.population: safety population: includes all study subjects that were consented and received investigational study material (i.e., at least one vaccination)

outcome.title: Characterization and Comparison of the Safety of the TD Vaccine System: (1) Solicited and Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) (2) Clinical Laboratory Safety (3) Serious AEs
outcome.description: Erythema, rash, pain, pruritus, hyperpigmentation, hypopigmentation and edema were solicited local AEs for the duration of the study. Fever, malaise, headache, and diarrhea were solicited systemic AEs for the first seven days following each vaccination; events reported outside this time frame were considered non-solicited.

group.title: Group 1 & 2 Combined: 37.5µg LT Patch
group.description: with or without swabbing

group.title: Group 3 & 4 Combined: Placebo Patch (0µg LT)
group.description: with or without swabbing

measure.title: Characterization and Comparison of the Safety of the TD Vaccine System: (1) Solicited and Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs) (2) Clinical Laboratory Safety (3) Serious AEs
measure.description: Erythema, rash, pain, pruritus, hyperpigmentation, hypopigmentation and edema were solicited local AEs for the duration of the study. Fever, malaise, headache, and diarrhea were solicited systemic AEs for the first seven days following each vaccination; events reported outside this time frame were considered non-solicited.

outcome.title: Characterization and Comparison of Group LT-specific Immune Responses to the TD Vaccine System: Geometric Mean Titers
outcome.description: LT immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin A (IgA)
outcome.population: the numbers analyzed differs from the Overall number analyzed because for this the Immunogenicity Evaluable Population (IEP) was used: includes all study subjects that were consented, randomized, received the assigned Treatments (both vaccinations) without significant protocol deviations and had blood drawn on Day 0, Day 21 and Day 35

group.title: LT Patch Without Swabbing
group.description: Two vaccination (Day 0 and Day 14) regimen with an LT patch (no swabbing), 37.5 mcg LT Heat-Labile Enterotoxin of E. coli (LT): Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

group.title: LT Patch With Swabbing
group.description: Two vaccination (Day 0 and Day 14) regimen with an LT patch (with swabbing), 37.5 mcg LT SPS:Buffer-prepared site swabbed with a 70% isopropyl alcohol pad Heat-Labile Enterotoxin of E. coli (LT): Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

group.title: Placebo Patch Without Swabbing
group.description: Two vaccination (Day 0 and Day 14) regimen with a placebo patch (no swabbing) Placebo: Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System

group.description: Two vaccination (Day 0 and Day 14) regimen with a placebo patch (with swabbing) SPS:Buffer-prepared site swabbed with a 70% isopropyl alcohol pad Placebo: Travelers' Diarrhea Vaccine System
